blog finished products may be sold anywhere but please give me credit as the designer and provide my blog address i am available to help if you run into any problems with a pattern i would love to hear how you liked the pattern and see pictures of your finished project thanks notes can be made in any size yarn use a hook which allows you to crochet tightly enough that the fiberfill will not poke through the holes crocheted in the round in one piece do not join rounds just keep working into the next stitch you can work decreases as regular decrease or single_crochet invisible decreases to do the latter insert hook into front loops only of next 2 stitches yarn over pull through 2 loops on hook yarn over pull through final 2 loops on hook materials bernat softee chunky yarn in any color you can get several octopuses from one skein i hook 12mm safety eyes cat eyes are good yarn needle for sewing in ends a small amount of fiberfill rattle optional skills and terms used magic_ring if you don t know this check youtube there are several good instructional videos single_crochet single_crochet 2sc make 2sc in the next stitch slip_stitch slip_stitch chain chain decrease single_crochet 2 stitched together or so invisible single_crochet decrease front loop only single_crochet again check youtube if you need instructions octopus 1 single_crochet 6 in a magic_ring pull tight 6 sts 2 2sc in each st 12 3 single_crochet 2sc six times 18 4 single_crochet in each st 18 5 single_crochet in each st 18 6 single_crochet in each st 18 7 single_crochet in each st 18 8 single_crochet in each st 18 9 single_crochet decrease six times 12 10 single_crochet decrease four times 8 completing the head portion mantle of the octopus 11 working in front loop only for this round only 2sc in each st 16 12 single_crochet in each st around 16 note ring of back loops inside octopus right photo 13 working in both loops single_crochet in next st ch10 turn in 2nd chain from the hook single_crochet single_crochet in the 8 remaining chains single_crochet into the next st from round 11 one tentacle completed 14 repeat step #13 seven 7 more times for a total of 8 tentacles **if you are feeling creative see tentacle variations at the end of the directions** 15 slip_stitch into the base of the first tentacle end leave a tail for sewing body closed 16 place eyes between row 8 and 9 or 9 and 10 3-5 sts apart closer spacing and higher eyes give a cuter octopus wider
